page.title: 17St.Gregory's Church,Marnhull
page.content: The parish church in Marnhull is dedicated to St.Gregory.The church was built in 1175 and part has been standing for 810 years.Originally it was called St.George's,but this has been changed.The Carent family tomb is interesting because it has the carved figure of a knight and his two wives. There are three services every Sunday, two of which are Communion. Coffee is served after Family Communion.There is also a service on Wednesdays.The church is used for weddings,funerals,christenings and concerts.There is bell ringing, a choir and also hand bell ringers.For children there is a Sunday Club,and for the ladies a Mothers Union group. St.Gregory's School was built by one of the rectors in 1874.The rector comes into school every Tuesday.
